strapiPost.title: Hot Connections
strapiPost.content:
The National Science Foundation granted nearly $18m to engineering researchers at the University of Arkansas to build and operate a national silicon carbide research and fabrication facility.

  • Advancement: Silicon carbide circuits make for powerful semiconductors, which work well in hot environments. The US currently has a void in the production of such circuits, relying on international fabrication. 
  • Unique access: The new facility will enable the US to provide local opportunity for research and experimentation. It will be available to external researchers being “the only openly accessible fabrication facility of its kind in the US.”
